Title: (SP25): 400 Status Code Error When Printing Cash Receipt Report
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
400 Status Code Error Occurs When Printing Cash Receipt Report Despite Successful Download
__Description:*
When a user selects the _From Date_ and _To Date_ in the _Cash Receipt Report_ screen and clicks the _Print_ button, a _400 Bad Request error_ appears in the network console. However, the report is still downloaded successfully. This error may indicate an _incorrect API request_ or _unnecessary validation issues_.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ The _Cash Receipt Report* module is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Reports > Cash Receipt Report_.
- Select a valid _From Date_ and _To Date_ in the date filters.
- Click the _Print_ button.
- Observe the network logs in the browser's developer console (_F12 > Network tab_).
__Expected Result:*
_ The _report should be printed/downloaded successfully_ without any _error messages*.
_ No _400 status code* should be logged in the network console.
_ If there is an issue with the request, a _clear validation or error message* should be displayed to the user.
__Actual Result:*
_ The report is _successfully downloaded*.
_ However, the network console logs a _400 Bad Request error*.
_ No _informational message* is shown to the user regarding the error.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Investigate _why the request is returning a 400 error* even though the report is being downloaded.
_ Ensure that the _API request for printing_ is correctly formatted and _does not contain invalid parameters*.
_ If the request is expected to fail under certain conditions, show a _clear validation message* to the user instead of silently logging an error.
__Severity:*
? _Medium_ ? The report is still downloaded, but the error might indicate deeper API or validation issues that could cause failures in the future.

Title: (SP25): Cash Receipt Report Displays Data Without Any Filter Selection
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Cash Receipt Report Automatically Displays Data Upon Navigation Without Applying Any Filters
__Description:*
When navigating to the _Cash Receipt Report_ module, the report automatically displays and loads data _without requiring any user-selected filters_. This can lead to _incorrect or unintended data being displayed_, potentially exposing unnecessary financial information.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ The _Cash Receipt Report* module is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Reports > Cash Receipt Report_.
- Observe that the report _immediately loads and displays data_ without requiring any filter selection.
__Expected Result:*
_ The report should _not load or display any data_ unless the user selects the _required filters (e.g., date range, payment method, account, etc.)*.
_ Instead, an _informational message_ should appear, prompting the user to _apply filters before displaying data*.
__Actual Result:*
_ The report _automatically displays data_ upon navigation _without any user input*.
_ This behavior may lead to _unintended data visibility issues_ and can _impact performance* due to unnecessary data loading.
__Suggested Fix:*
* Prevent the report from automatically displaying data upon navigation.
_ Implement a _filter requirement_, ensuring that users _must select at least one filter* before retrieving report data.
_ Display an _informational message*: _"Please select filters before generating the report."_
__Severity:*
? _Medium_ ? Could lead to unnecessary data exposure and performance inefficiencies.

Title: (SP25): Cash Receipt Report Uses a Single Date Input Field for "From" and "To" Dates, Causing Inconsistencies
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Cash Receipt Report Uses a Single Date Input Field for "From" and "To" Dates, Causing Inconsistencies
__Description:*
The _Cash Receipt Report_ screen provides only _one date input field with a single calendar_ to select both the _From Date_ and _To Date_. This implementation causes inconsistencies in date selection logic and triggers _unwanted required validation errors_, even when a valid date is selected.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ The _Cash Receipt Report* screen is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Reports > Cash Receipt Report_.
- Open the date input field to select a date range.
- Select a _From Date_ and observe that the same input is used for the _To Date_.
- Attempt to generate the report.
- Notice that an _unnecessary required validation message appears_, even though a valid date has been selected.
__Expected Result:*
_ There should be _two separate date fields_ for _From Date_ and _To Date*.
_ The system should correctly validate the date range without displaying _unnecessary required validation messages*.
* The report should be generated successfully when valid dates are selected.
__Actual Result:*
_ The system provides _only one date input field_ for both _From_ and _To* dates.
_ The user encounters _inconsistent behavior* when selecting date ranges.
_ A _required validation error_ is displayed _incorrectly*.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Implement _two separate date input fields_ for selecting _From Date_ and _To Date*.
_ Ensure that the validation logic _properly checks the selected date range*.
_ Remove unnecessary _required validation errors* that occur even when valid dates are selected.
__Severity:*
? _Medium_ ? Causes usability issues and may prevent users from generating reports properly.

Title: (Sp25): Cash Payment Report Uses a Single Date Input for "From" and "To" Dates, Causing Inconsistencies and Validation Issues
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Cash Payment Report Uses a Single Date Input for "From" and "To" Dates, Causing Inconsistencies and Validation Issues
__Description:*
The _Cash Payment Report_ screen allows users to filter reports using a _date range_; however, it only provides a _single date input field with one calendar_ to select both the _"From" and "To" dates_. This implementation leads to _inconsistencies_ in user input and causes the system to display _unwanted required validation messages_, making it difficult to generate reports correctly.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ The _Cash Payment Report* screen is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance App > Reports > Cash Payment Report_.
- Locate the _date input field_ for selecting the date range.
- Click the _calendar icon_ and select a date.
- Observe that the same _single date input field is used_ for both _"From" and "To"_ dates.
- Try to generate the report, and observe the _validation messages_.
__Expected Result:*
_ The report should have _two separate date input fields*:
__ _"From Date"_: Start of the date range.
__ _"To Date"_: End of the date range.
_ Users should be able to _select the date range correctly* without confusion.
_ The system should _not display unnecessary validation errors*.
__Actual Result:*
_ A _single date input field* is used for both "From" and "To" dates.
_ The system displays _inconsistent required validation messages*.
_ Users _cannot properly define a date range_, leading to _incorrect report filtering*.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Replace the _single date input field_ with _two separate date pickers* for "From" and "To" dates.
* Ensure the validation logic correctly checks whether both dates are selected.
_ Prevent _invalid date ranges* (e.g., "To Date" should not be earlier than "From Date").
__Severity:*
? _High_ ? Affects usability and accuracy of financial reports.

__Title:*
Validation Message Incorrectly Displays After Selecting a Date from the Calendar in [Cash Payment Report|https://ibrahimmohamed.microtecdev.com:2050/finance/reports/cash-payment-report]
__Description:*
When the user selects a _day_ from the _calendar widget_ and clicks once, the selected date is correctly _inputted in the label_, but the system _still displays a required validation message_ incorrectly. However, when the user _clicks the same date twice_, the validation message does _not_ appear unnecessarily. This behavior causes _user confusion_ as the field appears valid but is still flagged as required.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ A date input field with a _calendar widget* is available.

- Select _any day_ and click it _once_.

- Click the same date _twice_.
- Observe that the validation message disappears.
__Expected Result:*
_ _After a single click_, the system should recognize the selected date and _not display the required validation message*.
_ The validation message should _only_ appear if the user attempts to submit the form _without selecting a date*.
__Actual Result:*
_ After _one click_, the date is set correctly, but the required validation message _is incorrectly displayed*.
_ After _two clicks_, the validation message _disappears*, even though the selection was already valid after the first click.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Ensure the _validation check_ properly detects that a date is selected _after one click*.

_ Test the date picker behavior to ensure _consistent input handling*.

Title: (Sp25): Printing Cash Payment Receipt Without Input Data Returns a 400 Error Without Informational Message
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Printing Cash Payment Receipt Without Input Data Returns a 400 Error Without Informational Message
__Description:*
When the user clicks the _Print_ button on the _Cash Payment Receipt_ screen _without selecting or inputting any data_, the system triggers a _400 Bad Request error_ in the network. Additionally, the API request _incorrectly includes a_ {{payment method}} _query parameter_, even though no valid input was provided. The system does not display an _informational message_ to inform the user about the missing required data.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system with appropriate access.
_ The _Cash Payment Receipt* module is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module ? Transactions ? Cash Payment Receipt_.
- Do _not_ select or input any required data (e.g., Payment Details, Amount, Payment Method).
- Click the _Print_ button.
- Observe the system behavior and network logs.
__Expected Result:*
_ The system should _not trigger a 400 error*.
_ An _informational message* should be displayed:
_"Please enter the required details before printing the payment receipt."_
_ The _API request should not include invalid query parameters (e.g.,_ {{payment method}}_)* when no input is provided.
__Actual Result:*
_ A _400 Bad Request* error is triggered in the network log.
* The request includes an incorrect {{payment method}} parameter despite no input.
* No validation message is displayed, leaving the user without guidance.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ _Implement validation* to prevent the print action if required fields are empty.
_ Display a _clear informational message* before attempting to send the request.
_ Ensure the API request _does not include invalid parameters* when no data is provided.
__Severity:*
?? _High_ ? The issue affects core functionality, causing errors and a poor user experience.

Title: (SP24): Payment Reconciliation Report Does Not Display Reconciled Invoices for Selected Customer
Description:
### Description
__Payment Reconciliation Report Does Not Display Reconciled Invoices for Selected Customer*
__Title:*
Payment Reconciliation Report Fails to Display Reconciled Invoices and Shows Incorrect Invoice List
__Description:*
On the _Payment Reconciliation Report_ screen, when a user selects a customer, the report _does not display_ the invoices that have been _successfully reconciled_. Instead, the _Select Invoice_ dropdown incorrectly shows _only non-reconciled invoices_, preventing users from accessing reconciliation details. This issue affects financial reporting accuracy and reconciliation tracking.
__Preconditions:*
_ The user is logged into the ERP system with access to the _Payment Reconciliation Report* module.
* At least one invoice has been successfully reconciled for the selected customer.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module ? Reports ? Payment Reconciliation Report_.
- Select a _customer_ who has reconciled invoices.
- Open the _Select Invoice_ dropdown.
- Observe that the dropdown _only lists non-reconciled invoices_ instead of displaying reconciled ones.
- Attempt to generate a reconciliation report and notice that _no data appears_ for reconciled invoices.
__Expected Result:*
_ The _Select Invoice_ dropdown should display _both fully and partially reconciled invoices* for the selected customer.
_ The report should correctly show _reconciliation details_, including _invoice status, reconciled amount, and remaining balance*.
__Actual Result:*
_ The dropdown incorrectly lists only _non-reconciled invoices*, preventing users from selecting reconciled invoices.
_ The report does not show _any data* for reconciled invoices.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Modify the query logic to _include reconciled invoices_ in the _Select Invoice* dropdown.
_ Ensure that the _report correctly fetches and displays* reconciliation details.
_ Validate that the system retrieves _both fully and partially reconciled invoices* for the selected customer.
__Severity:*
?? _High_ ? This issue impacts financial reporting and reconciliation tracking, leading to incorrect financial records.

Title: (Sp24): Amount Field in Add Payment In Screen Accepts Negative Numbers Without Validation
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Negative Amounts Can Be Entered and Saved in Payment In Screen Without Validation
__Description:*
On the _Add Payment In_ screen, the _Amount_ field in the _Detail Section_ allows users to enter negative values. The system successfully _saves and posts_ the transaction without any validation or error message. This issue leads to severe inconsistencies in _financial calculations, reconciliation, and related module transactions_, affecting overall system accuracy.
__Preconditions:*
_ The user is logged into the ERP system with permission to create and post _Payment In* transactions.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module ? Transactions ? Add Payment In_ screen.
- In the _Detail Section_, enter a _negative amount_ (e.g., {{-1000}}).
- Click _Save_, then _Post_ the transaction.
- Observe that the system allows the transaction to be saved and posted without validation.
- Check the related financial reports, reconciliation, and transaction history to see discrepancies.
__Expected Result:*
_ The system should _not allow_ negative values in the _Amount* field.
_ If a negative value is entered, an _error message* should be displayed, preventing the user from saving or posting the transaction.
* Proper validation should be enforced to ensure only positive values are accepted.
__Actual Result:*
_ The system allows negative amounts in the _Amount* field.
* The transaction is successfully saved and posted without any validation.
_ This leads to financial calculation errors in _balancing, reconciliation, and other dependent modules*.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Implement _validation_ to restrict negative values in the _Amount* field.
_ Display a clear _error message* when a negative value is entered.
* Prevent transactions with negative amounts from being saved or posted.
_ Conduct a _system-wide audit* to check if similar validation issues exist in other financial modules.
__Severity:*
?? _Critical_ ? This issue impacts financial accuracy, reconciliation, and balance calculations, leading to serious financial discrepancies.

Title: (SP24) @General: Search Functionality Not Working in Advanced Search (Select Account Dialog) Across All ERP System Modules (Add/Edit Screens)
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Search Functionality Fails in the Advanced Search Dialog for Selecting an Account Across Multiple ERP Modules
__Description:*
In multiple modules of the ERP system, including _Treasury Definition, Bank Definition, Payment In, and Payment Out_, the _Advanced Search (Select Account)_ dialog does not filter results when the user enters a search term. This issue prevents users from efficiently finding and selecting an account, leading to delays and poor user experience.
__Affected Modules:*
* Treasury Definition Add/Edit
* Bank Definition Add/Edit
* Payment In Add/Edit
* Payment Out Add/Edit
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system with appropriate access to the affected modules.
* The system contains existing accounts available for selection.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to any of the affected modules (e.g., _Treasury Definition Add/Edit_).
- Click on the _Select Account_ field to open the _Advanced Search Dialog_.
- In the search input field, type an account name or account code.
- Observe that no filtering or search results appear based on the entered query.
__Expected Result:*
* As the user types in the search field, the system should dynamically filter and display relevant account results.
_ The search should support filtering based on _account name_ or _account code*.
_ If no results match the search term, an appropriate _"No results found"* message should be displayed.
__Actual Result:*
* The search input does not trigger any filtering of the account list.
* The full list of accounts remains unchanged, even when entering a search term.
* Users are unable to efficiently locate specific accounts, leading to a poor user experience.
__Suggested Fix:*
* Ensure that the search input field triggers a request to filter the accounts dynamically.
_ Validate whether _API requests* for search functionality are being made correctly.
_ Implement _debouncing* to prevent excessive search requests.
_ Ensure that the search function considers both _account name_ and _account code*.
* Display an appropriate message when no matching results are found.
__Severity:*
_High_ ? The inability to search for accounts across multiple modules significantly impacts user workflow and system efficiency.

Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Incorrect icon for the Print button, incorrect order of action buttons, and missing tooltips in the Fund Transfer List View.
----
__Description:*
In the _Fund Transfer List View_, the following issues are observed:
- The _Print_ button has the same icon as the _View_ button, causing confusion for users.
- The order of the action buttons (e.g., View, Edit, Delete, Print) is not correct or consistent with the application's design standards.
- No tooltips are displayed when hovering over the action buttons, making it difficult for users to understand their functionality.
These issues affect the usability and user experience of the Fund Transfer List View.
----

- The user is logged in with the necessary permissions.
- The _Fund Transfer List View_ is accessible.
- At least one Fund Transfer record exists in the system.
----

- Navigate to _Finance Module > Transaction Submenu > Fund Transfer_.
- Observe the action buttons (e.g., View, Edit, Delete, Print) in the List View.
- Hover over each action button to check for tooltips.

- Verify the order of the action buttons.
----

Title: (SP24): Unexpected error message "Cost centers are required for this account: Automation Detailed account." displayed when posting a Fund Transfer from Treasury (Cash) to Bank (Transfer).
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Unexpected error message _"Cost centers are required for this account: Automation Detailed account."_ displayed when posting a Fund Transfer from Treasury (Cash) to Bank (Transfer).
----
__Description:*
When a user attempts to post a Fund Transfer transaction from a _Treasury_ account (with _Cash_ payment method) to a _Bank_ account (with _Transfer_ payment method), an unexpected error message is displayed after clicking the _Post_ button. The error message reads:
_"Cost centers are required for this account: Automation Detailed account."_
This error occurs even though all required data is entered in the _Fund Transfer Add_ screen, and the transaction is saved successfully when clicking the _Save_ button. The error appears in a pop-up and is also logged in the network log with a status code of _400 (Bad Request)_.
----
__Precondition:*
- The user is logged in with the necessary permissions.
- Valid _Treasury_ and _Bank_ accounts are available in the system.
- The _Treasury_ account has a _Cash_ payment method, and the _Bank_ account has a _Transfer_ payment method.
- The _Automation Detailed account_ has _Cost Center Configuration (Not Allow)_
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Transaction Submenu > Fund Transfer_.
- Click on the _Add_ button to open the Fund Transfer Add screen.
- In the _Send From_ section:
-_ Select _Treasury_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ Select a valid Treasury in the _Payment Hub Details* field.
-_ Ensure the _Payment Method_ is set to _Cash*.
- In the _Receive To_ section:
-_ Select _Bank_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ Select a valid Bank and Bank Account in the _Payment Hub Details* field.
-_ Ensure the _Payment Method_ is set to _Transfer*.
- Enter a valid _Amount to Send_.
- Click on the _Save_ button to save the transaction.
- Click on the _Post_ button to post the transaction.
- Observe the system behavior.
----
__Expected Result:*
* The system should post the Fund Transfer transaction successfully without errors.
* No error messages should be displayed in the pop-up or network log.
----
__Actual Result:*
* The system displays an unexpected error message in a pop-up:
_"Cost centers are required for this account: Automation Detailed account."_
_ The error is also logged in the network log with a status code of _400 (Bad Request)*.
* The transaction is not posted, and the user is unable to complete the Fund Transfer.
----
__Impact:*
* Users cannot post Fund Transfer transactions from Treasury (Cash) to Bank (Transfer) when the linked account requires a cost center.
* This issue disrupts the workflow of the Finance team and may lead to delays in financial operations.
----
__Severity:*
_High_ ? This is a critical functionality issue that prevents users from completing essential financial transactions.
----
__Priority:*
_Urgent_ ? This issue needs immediate attention as it affects core functionality.

Title: (SP24): Non-descriptive error message displayed in a pop-up when selecting a Bank account with an invalid payment method.
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Non-descriptive error message displayed in a pop-up when selecting a Bank account with an invalid payment method.
----
__Description:*
When a user selects a _Bank account_ that has a payment method other than _Transfer_ (e.g., Visa or Span) in the _Fund Transfer Add_ screen, a non-descriptive error message is displayed in a pop-up at the bottom layer. The message reads:
_"Error you can't select bank without payment method."_
This message is not informative, does not guide the user to resolve the issue, and appears in an incorrect view (pop-up at the bottom layer). According to the business rules, only Bank accounts with the _Transfer_ payment method should be selectable for Fund Transfers.
----
__Precondition:*
- The user is logged in with the necessary permissions.
- The _Fund Transfer Add_ screen is accessible.
- At least one Bank account exists in the system with a payment method other than _Transfer_ (e.g., Visa or Span).
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Transaction Submenu > Fund Transfer_.
- Click on the _Add_ button to open the Fund Transfer Add screen.
- In the _Send From_ section:
-_ Select _Bank_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ In the _Payment Hub Details_ field, select a Bank account that has a payment method other than _Transfer* (e.g., Visa or Span).
- Observe the system behavior.
----
__Expected Result:*
_ The system should display a _clear and informative error message_ in the correct view (e.g., near the _Payment Hub Details* field or in a modal dialog).
_ The error message should guide the user to select a Bank account with the _Transfer* payment method.
* Example of an informative message:
_"Invalid Payment Method: Please select a Bank account with the 'Transfer' payment method."_
----
__Actual Result:*
* A non-descriptive error message is displayed in a pop-up at the bottom layer:
_"Error you can't select bank without payment method."_
* The message does not specify the issue or guide the user to resolve it.
* The pop-up appears in an incorrect view (bottom layer), making it less noticeable.
----
__Impact:*
* Users are confused by the non-descriptive error message and may not understand how to resolve the issue.
* The incorrect placement of the pop-up (bottom layer) makes it easy to miss, leading to frustration and delays in completing the transaction.
* This issue affects the user experience and may result in incorrect data entry or abandoned transactions.
----
__Severity:*
_Medium_ ? This is a usability issue that impacts the user experience but does not prevent the core functionality from working.
----
__Priority:*
_High_ ? The error message needs to be improved to ensure users can complete their tasks efficiently.
----
__Attachments:*
- Screenshot of the non-descriptive error message in the pop-up.
- Screenshot of the Fund Transfer Add screen with the selected Bank account.
- Logs or additional error details from the system.
----
__Root Cause Analysis (If Available):*
The issue occurs because:
- The system allows the selection of Bank accounts with payment methods other than _Transfer_, even though the business rules specify that only _Transfer_ is acceptable.
- The error message is hardcoded and does not provide sufficient context or guidance.
- The pop-up is displayed in an incorrect view (bottom layer), making it less noticeable and user-friendly.
----
__Suggested Fix:*
- _Validation Rule:_
-_ Update the system to filter and display only Bank accounts with the _Transfer_ payment method in the _Payment Hub Details* dropdown.
-* If a Bank account with an invalid payment method is selected, prevent the selection and display an informative error message in the correct view.
- _Error Message:_
-* Replace the non-descriptive message with a clear and informative one, such as:
-_"Invalid Payment Method: Please select a Bank account with the 'Transfer' payment method."_
- _UI/UX Improvement:_
-_ Display the error message near the _Payment Hub Details* field or in a modal dialog for better visibility.
-* Ensure the message is displayed in a user-friendly format (e.g., red text with an icon).

Title: (Sp24): Error message with status code 500 displayed in the network log when transferring funds from Bank (Transfer) to Treasury (Cash).
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Error message with status code 500 displayed in the network log when transferring funds from Bank (Transfer) to Treasury (Cash).
----
__Description:*
When a user attempts to transfer a valid amount of money from a _Bank_ account (with _Transfer_ payment method) to a _Treasury_ account (with _Cash_ payment method) using the _Fund Transfer Add_ screen, the system fails to save the transaction. An error message is displayed in the network log with a status code _500_, and the transaction is not processed.
----
__Precondition:*
- The user is logged in with the necessary permissions.
- Valid _Bank_ and _Treasury_ accounts are available in the system.
- The _Bank_ account has a _Transfer_ payment method, and the _Treasury_ account has a _Cash_ payment method.
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Transaction Submenu > Fund Transfer_.
- Click on the _Add_ button to open the Fund Transfer Add screen.
- Set the _Date_ (defaults to today).
- In the _Send From_ section:
-_ Select _Bank_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ Select a valid Bank and Bank Account in the _Payment Hub Details* field.
-_ Ensure the _Payment Method_ is set to _Transfer*.
- In the _Receive To_ section:
-_ Select _Treasury_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ Select a valid Treasury in the _Payment Hub Details* field.
-_ Ensure the _Payment Method_ is set to _Cash*.
- Enter a valid _Amount to Send_.
- Click on the _Save_ button.
- Observe the network log using browser developer tools (F12).
----
__Expected Result:*
* The system should save the Fund Transfer record successfully.
* The transaction should be processed without errors.
* No error messages should be displayed in the network log.
----
__Actual Result:*
* The system fails to save the Fund Transfer record.
* An error message is displayed in the network log with the following details:
{color:-ffffff}json{color}
{color:-ffffff}Copy{color}
{noformat}{
  "correlationId": "f40e9ff5-740d-442d-925d-13b40edfaba6",
  "message": "An error occurred while saving the entity changes. See the inner exception for details.",
  "messageCode": 3006,
  "validationErrors": null
}{noformat}
_ The status code in the network log is _500 (Internal Server Error)*.
----
__Impact:*
* Users cannot complete Fund Transfer transactions from Bank (Transfer) to Treasury (Cash).
* This issue disrupts the workflow of the Finance team and may lead to delays in financial operations.
----
__Severity:*
_High_ ? This is a critical functionality issue that prevents users from performing essential financial transactions.
----
__Priority:*
_Urgent_ ? This issue needs immediate attention as it affects core functionality.
----
__Attachments:*
- Screenshot of the error message in the network log.
- Screenshot of the Fund Transfer Add screen with the entered data.
- Logs or additional error details from the server.
----
__Root Cause Analysis (If Available):*
The error message suggests that the issue occurs while saving the entity changes. The inner exception (not visible in the logs) may provide more details about the specific cause. Possible causes include:
* A mismatch between the payment methods (Transfer and Cash) during the transaction processing.
* A database constraint or validation rule that is not being handled correctly.
* An issue with the entity mapping or data persistence logic.
----
__Suggested Fix:*
- Investigate the inner exception details to identify the exact cause of the error.
- Ensure that the system handles the combination of _Transfer_ (Bank) and _Cash_ (Treasury) payment methods correctly.
- Validate the entity mapping and database constraints to ensure they align with the business rules.
- Add proper error handling and user-friendly messages to guide users in case of similar issues.
----
__Additional Notes:*
* This issue should be tested in the development environment before deploying to production.
* Regression testing should be performed to ensure that other Fund Transfer scenarios (e.g., Bank to Bank, Treasury to Treasury) are not affected.
----

Title: (SP24): Save Button Successfully Saves Reconciliation but Does Not Redirect or Reset the Screen
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Save Button Successfully Saves Reconciliation but Does Not Redirect or Reset the Screen
__Description:*
On the _Payment Reconciliation_ screen in the _Finance App_, after clicking the _Save_ button, the reconciliation is successfully saved, and a _success popup_ is displayed. However, the screen remains stuck, and all manipulated fields still retain the same data and state instead of refreshing or redirecting. This creates confusion for users as they are unsure whether the reconciliation has been processed correctly.
__Preconditions:*
_ The user is logged into the ERP system with access to the _Finance App*.
_ The user has navigated to _Finance Module ? Transactions ? Payment Reconciliation*.
* A customer and a payment have been selected.
* One or more invoices have been selected for reconciliation.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module ? Transactions ? Payment Reconciliation_.
- Select a customer from the _Customer Selection_ popup.
- Select a payment from the _Payment Selection_ popup.
- Choose one or more invoices for reconciliation.
- Click the _Reconcile_ button to apply the payment.
- Click the _Save_ button.
- Observe that the reconciliation is successfully saved, and a _success popup_ appears.
- Notice that the screen does not refresh or redirect, and the fields still show the same data.
__Expected Result:*
* After successful reconciliation, the screen should either:
__ Redirect the user to the _Payment Reconciliation List_ screen.
__ Refresh and reset the fields to their default state.
* The previously reconciled invoices should no longer appear as pending reconciliation.
_ The UI should provide a _clear indication* that the process has been completed.
__Actual Result:*
_ The _Save* button successfully saves the reconciliation and displays a success popup.
* The screen remains unchanged with all manipulated fields retaining the same data.
* Users are unsure whether the reconciliation was actually processed.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Implement a _screen refresh or redirection* after successful reconciliation.
_ Automatically _reset all fields* and update the invoice list to reflect the reconciliation.
_ Ensure that reconciled invoices are _removed from the pending list*.
* Provide a clear confirmation message indicating that the process is complete and that no further action is required.
__Severity:*
_Medium-High_ ? The issue does not prevent reconciliation but causes confusion and inefficiency for users.

Title: (SP21) @General: Search Functionality Sends Excessive Requests Due to Lack of Debouncing
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
Search Functionality Sends Excessive Requests Due to Lack of Debouncing
----
_Description:_
The search functionality does not efficiently handle user input, causing an excessive number of requests to be sent to the server. Each time the user types a character, a request is immediately triggered, even if the time between keystrokes is less than one second. This can lead to server overload, performance issues, and unnecessary network traffic. Implementing _debouncing_ should optimize the search behavior.
----
_Precondition:_
* The ERP system is accessible, and the user has access to the search feature.
----
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Log in to the ERP system.
- Navigate to a screen where the search functionality is available.
- Start typing a search term letter by letter.
- Observe that each keystroke triggers a request without waiting for a pause in typing.
----
_Expected Result:_
_ The search functionality should implement _debouncing*, meaning it waits for a short delay (e.g., 500?800ms) after the user stops typing before sending a request.
* This reduces unnecessary server requests and improves performance.
----
_Actual Result:_
* A request is sent for every character typed, even if the delay between keystrokes is very short.
* This causes excessive API calls, leading to increased server load and potential performance degradation.
----
_Suggested Fix:_
_ Implement _Debouncing* in the search functionality to delay API requests until the user has stopped typing for a defined period (e.g., 500?800ms).

Title: (Sp21): Unable to Save Return Purchase Invoice Due to Unposted Transaction
Description:
### Description
__Title: Unable to Save Return Purchase Invoice Due to Unposted Transaction*
__Issue Description:*
When the user attempts to _return items_ using the _"Return Purchase Invoice" Add_ screen and saves the transaction without posting it, they are unable to create another return transaction for the same invoice.
On the second attempt to return items from the same invoice, clicking the _Save_ button _does nothing_, and the _network log_ shows an error with _Status Code 500_.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Return Purchase Invoice Add_ screen.
- Select a _Purchase Invoice_ to return items from.
- Fill in all _required data_ and return _each item's available quantity_.
- Click _Save_ (but do not post the transaction).
- Open the _Return Purchase Invoice Add_ screen again and select the _same invoice_.
- Fill in all _required data_ and attempt to _return the items again_.
- Click _Save_ and observe that _nothing happens_.
- Check the _network log_, which shows _HTTP 500 Internal Server Error_.
__Expected Behavior:*
_ The system should _display an informative message_ if there is an _unposted* return transaction related to the same Purchase Invoice.
_ The message should guide the user to either _post_ or _cancel* the pending return before proceeding with a new one.
_ The system should _not fail silently*, and it should prevent the user from facing an unexpected error.
__Actual Behavior:*
_ When the user attempts to save a second _Return Purchase Invoice* for the same invoice:
__ Clicking the _Save_ button does _nothing_.
__ The _network log_ shows an _HTTP 500 Internal Server Error_.
__ No error message is displayed to the user, leaving them confused.
h4. 
__Impact:*
_ Prevents users from _processing valid returns*.
_ Causes _confusion* due to the lack of an error message.
_ Results in _system instability* (HTTP 500 errors).
_ Affects the _accuracy of purchase return records*.
__Severity:_ _High*
This issue blocks users from completing return transactions, affecting inventory accuracy and financial records.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Implement _validation logic_ to check if an _unposted return transaction_ exists for the selected _Purchase Invoice*.
_ Display a _clear error message* before saving, such as:
_"There is an unposted return transaction related to this Purchase Invoice. Please post or cancel it before creating a new one."_
_ Ensure that the system _does not trigger a 500 error* and handles this scenario gracefully.

Title: (SP21): Help Button Navigation Issues
Description:
### Description
__Bug Report: Help Button Navigation Issues*
__Issue Description:*
When the user clicks the _Help_ button on any screen, the system navigates to the Help Pages. However, the following issues occur:
- _No Return to Previous Screen:_ There is no option to return back to the previous screen from the Help Pages.
- _Incorrect Back Navigation Behavior:_ If the user manually navigates back, it returns to the parent-related Help Pages instead of the previous screen.
- _Side Menu Displays Incorrect Options:_ The side menu incorrectly displays _General Settings_ module options instead of maintaining the context of the previously accessed screen.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to any module or transaction screen (e.g., Sales Invoice, Purchase Order, etc.).
- Click on the _Help_ button.
- Observe that the system navigates to the _Help Pages_ instead of opening in a new tab.
- Attempt to navigate back using the browser back button.
- Notice that it does not return to the previous screen but instead loads parent-related help pages.
- Observe the side menu displaying _General Settings_ instead of the relevant module options.
__Expected Behavior:*
_ The Help Page should open in a _new window_ or _new tab* instead of redirecting the user from the current screen.
_ If the Help Page is opened in the same window, a _clear return option* should be provided to navigate back to the previously accessed screen.
* The side menu should remain consistent with the user's previously selected module / App, not default to General Settings.
__Actual Behavior:*
* The system redirects the user away from their current work screen when they click the Help button.
* There is no direct way to return to the screen where the user clicked the Help button.
_ The side menu shows _General Settings* options instead of the appropriate module.
__Impact:*
* Interrupts user workflow as they lose their place in the system.
* Causes confusion due to incorrect navigation and missing return functionality.
* Leads to inefficiency since users have to manually navigate back to the intended module.
__Severity:_ _Medium to High*
This issue affects usability and navigation across all modules, causing disruptions in user experience.
__Suggested Fix:*
_ Modify the Help Button functionality to _open the Help Pages in a new tab or window* instead of navigating away.
_ Ensure that if the Help Page opens in the same window, there is a _Return to Previous Page* button.
* Maintain the side menu context based on the user's current module instead of defaulting to General Settings.

Title: SP 22 - Unit of Measurement: Save Button Shows Error Messages on First Click but Works on Second Click
Description:
### Description
_Description_:
In the _Unit of Measurement_ screen, when editing an existing record, clicking the _Save_ button the first time results in error messages being displayed. However, clicking the _Save_ button again allows the process to complete successfully. This inconsistent behavior affects the user experience and may cause confusion.
_Steps to Reproduce_:
- Navigate to the _Unit of Measurement_ screen.
- Select an existing _Unit of Measurement_ and click _Edit_.
- Make changes to any editable field.
- Click the _Save_ button once.
- Observe that error messages appear, preventing the save.
- Click the _Save_ button a second time.
_Expected Result_:
The _Save_ button should work correctly on the first click without displaying error messages if all required fields are filled correctly.
_Actual Result_:
* On the first click, error messages appear, preventing the save operation.
* On the second click, the save operation completes successfully without issues.

Title: (Sp21): Unexpected Stock Increase When Posting a Purchase Invoice Multiple Times
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
Unexpected Stock Increase When Posting a Purchase Invoice Multiple Times
_Description:_
In the _Purchase Invoice_ screen of the Purchase App, an unexpected behavior occurs when posting an invoice. Each time the user clicks the _Post_ button, the item's stock quantity increases. This issue is visible in the _Item Card Report_ and the _Stock Out Add Screen_ under the _Item Availability_ field. However, the _Purchase Invoice List View_ correctly shows only one posted purchase invoice, and the _Stock In_ screen reflects only one _Posted Stock In_ entry from the purchase.
----
__Precondition:*
* User is logged into the Purchase App.
_ The user has access to the _Purchase Invoice* module.
_ At least one _item* exists in the inventory.
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to the _Purchase Invoice_ screen.
- Fill in all required fields, including _Supplier, Date, and Item Details_.
- Add an _item_ with a valid quantity.
- Click _Save_ to create the purchase invoice.
- Click _Post_ button _Multiple_ time to finalize the purchase invoice.
- Observe the _Item Card Report_ and _Stock Out Add Screen (Item Availability field)_ ? stock increases.
- Observe that the stock quantity increases again, even though only one purchase invoice is recorded in the _List View_ and _Stock In Screen_.
----
__Expected Result:*
_ The system should prevent multiple postings of the same _Purchase Invoice*.
_ Clicking _Post* multiple times should not result in duplicate stock increases.
_ Stock quantity updates should match the actual _Posted Purchase Invoice* count.
* If the invoice is already posted, the system should display an error message like:
_"This Purchase Invoice has already been posted. No further stock updates are required."_
----
__Actual Result:*
_ Clicking the _Post* button multiple times increases the stock quantity incorrectly.
_ The _Item Card Report_ and _Stock Out Add Screen* reflect inflated stock values.
_ The _Purchase Invoice List View_ and _Stock In Screen* correctly show only one posted invoice.
----
__Severity:*
_Critical_ ? Leads to incorrect stock levels, impacting inventory management and financial reporting.
__Priority:*
_High_ ? Needs immediate resolution to prevent stock discrepancies.

Title: (SP21): System Allows Posting 'Return Purchase Invoice' with a Date Before the 'Purchase Invoice' Date
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
System Allows Posting 'Return Purchase Invoice' with a Date Before the 'Purchase Invoice' Date
_Description:_
In the Purchase App, the system allows users to post a _Return Purchase Invoice_ with a date that is earlier than the original _Purchase Invoice_ date. This leads to logical inconsistencies in financial records, as an invoice return should not precede the purchase itself.
_Precondition:_
* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* User has access to the 'Return Purchase Invoice' functionality.
_ A valid _Purchase Invoice* exists in the system.
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Navigate to the _Return Purchase Invoice_ Add Screen.
- Select an existing _Purchase Invoice_ from the list.
- Enter a _Return Purchase Invoice Date_ that is earlier than the selected _Purchase Invoice Date_.
- Click on the _Post_ button to submit the return invoice.
_Expected Result:_
_ The system should validate the _Return Purchase Invoice Date_ and prevent posting if it is earlier than the corresponding _Purchase Invoice Date*.
* An appropriate error message should be displayed, such as:
_"Return Purchase Invoice date cannot be earlier than the original Purchase Invoice date."_
_Actual Result:_
_ The system accepts and posts the _Return Purchase Invoice_ even if its date is before the _Purchase Invoice Date*.
* This results in an illogical transaction where a return occurs before the purchase.

Title: (SP21): System Accepts Discount Amount Greater Than Cost in Purchase Invoice but Displays Incorrect Validation After Save and Post
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
System Accepts Discount Amount Greater Than Cost in Purchase Invoice but Displays Incorrect Validation After Save and Post
_Description:_
When a user inputs a discount amount greater than the cost in the Purchase Invoice, the system allows this value to be entered. However, upon clicking the "Save" button, a descriptive validation message appears, prompting the user to correct the discount amount. Once the user clears the greater discount and enters a valid value, the transaction is saved successfully. But when the user clicks the "Post" button, an undescriptive validation message is displayed with network error messages such as "Cost must be positive" and "Quantity must be positive." This behavior indicates that the system either does not correctly clear cache or does not respond properly to changes in field values.
_Precondition:_
* User is logged into the ERP system.
* The user is on the Purchase Invoice screen.
* The discount amount is entered as greater than the cost.
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Navigate to the Purchase app > Purchase Invoice.
- Enter all required fields for the purchase invoice.
- Click Add new Line to add new item
- Select Items from the Dropdown and input valid Quantity and Cost
- Input a discount amount that is greater than the item cost.
- Click the "Save" button.
- A descriptive validation message is shown indicating the discount amount is greater than the cost.
- Correct the discount amount to a valid value and click the "Save" button again. The transaction is saved successfully.
- Click the "Post" button to try to post the transaction.
_Expected Result:_
* The discount amount should not be allowed to exceed the cost value in the first place.
* After inputting valid values and saving the transaction, the post operation should succeed without any validation errors.
_Actual Result:_
* The system allows the discount amount to exceed the cost.
* After saving, the user receives a validation message that prompts them to adjust the discount amount.
* After entering a valid discount and saving the transaction, the user encounters an undescriptive validation message when trying to post the transaction.
* The network error messages include "Cost must be positive" and "Quantity must be positive," even though the data appears to be correct.
* The system does not correctly clear cache or respond properly to field value changes, causing the undescriptive error.

Title: (SP21): System Allows Deletion of Tax Groups Assigned to Tax Definitions
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
System Allows Deletion of Tax Groups Assigned to Tax Definitions
----
_Description:_
The system incorrectly permits the deletion of tax groups that are already assigned to tax definitions. This behavior can lead to broken references, data inconsistencies, and operational issues when processing taxes within the system.
----
_Precondition:_
* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with permissions to manage tax groups and tax definitions.
* A tax group is assigned to one or more tax definitions.
----
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Log in to the ERP system.
- Navigate to the General Settings APP >>> _Tax Group_ screen.
- Identify a tax group that is assigned to one or more tax definitions.
- Attempt to delete the tax group.
----
_Expected Result:_
The system should prevent deletion of tax groups that are assigned to tax definitions, displaying a validation error message such as:
* "This tax group cannot be deleted as it is assigned to active tax definitions."
----
_Actual Result:_
The system allows deletion of tax groups that are assigned to tax definitions without any validation, resulting in:
* Broken references in the associated tax definitions.
* Inability to process taxes that rely on the deleted tax group.

_Description:_
When attempting to add a customer definition with all required fields filled but no open financial year, the system enters an infinite loading state. Upon clicking the "Save" button:
- A "Open Financial Year" popup appears in the background (bottom layer).

- Navigate to the _Customer Definition Add_ form.
- Fill in all required fields in the form.
- Ensure there is no open financial year in the system.
- Click the _"Save"_ button.
----
_Expected Result:_
A clear and actionable message should be displayed, such as:
* Informing the user that no financial year is open.
* Providing a button or option to resolve the issue (e.g., open a financial year or contact admin).
The save operation should not trigger an infinite loading state.
----
_Actual Result:_
* A "Open Financial Year" popup appears in the background (bottom layer).
* An infinite circular progress bar is displayed in the foreground (top layer), making the system appear stuck.

Description:
### Description
_Title:_
System enables multiple success payment operations upon repeated clicks of "Proceed to Offline Payment" and "Proceed to Online Payment" Buttons
_Description:_
When the user clicks the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button, the system displays a success confirmation message. However, the _Invoice Payment_ screen remains open with the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ and _"Proceed to Online Payment"_ buttons still actionable. This allows users to repeatedly perform the payment operation, resulting in multiple success confirmation messages and potentially duplicate payments.
_Precondition:_
- The user is on the _Invoice Payment_ screen with an unpaid invoice.
- Both _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ and _"Proceed to Online Payment"_ buttons are enabled.
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Log in to the admin portal as a user.
- Navigate to the _Invoice Payment_ screen.
- Click the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button.
- Observe the success confirmation message.
- From the _Invoice Payment_ screen and click the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button again.
- Repeat the process and observe multiple success confirmation messages.
- From the _Invoice Payment_ screen and click the _"Proceed to Online Payment"_ button.
- Complete Payment process with Correct Visa information.
_Expected Result:_
- After a successful offline payment, the system should disable the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ and _"Proceed to Online Payment"_ buttons for the invoice.
- The user should be redirected to a confirmation page or the payment screen should update to reflect the payment status (e.g., marked as paid).
- Multiple payment operations should be prevented for the same invoice.
_Actual Result:_
- The success confirmation message is displayed after each click on the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button.
- The _Invoice Payment_ screen remains open, with both payment buttons still actionable.
- Multiple success payment operations are allowed, causing confusion and potential duplicate payments.

Missing descriptive validation error when clicking "Proceed to Offline Payment" with an incorrectly formatted password
_Description:_
When clicking the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button, if the user inputs a password that does not match the required format, no clear or descriptive validation error is displayed. This leaves the user unaware of why the action cannot proceed, despite all other required fields being filled correctly.
_Precondition:_
- The user is on the _Offline Payment_ screen.
- All required fields are correctly filled, except the password field, which contains an invalid format.
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Log in to the admin portal as a user.
- Navigate to the _Offline Payment_ screen.
- Fill in all required fields with valid inputs except for the password, which should not meet the format requirements (e.g., missing special characters or required length).
- Click the _"Proceed to Offline Payment"_ button.
- Observe the validation behavior and error message (if any).
_Expected Result:_
A clear and descriptive validation error should appear, indicating the exact password format requirements (e.g., "Password must be at least 8 characters long and include a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters.").
_Actual Result:_
No clear or descriptive validation error is displayed. The user cannot proceed but is not informed of the reason, leading to confusion.

- Submit the invoice and verify the confirmation email ("Complete your Registration").

- The checkboxes for app selection should be clearly visible and actionable.
- The Preview Invoice should accurately display the selected apps and their associated costs.
- The confirmation email should include a detailed cost breakdown and the correct total.
----
__Actual Result:*
- Checkboxes for app selection are faint or blend into the background, making them difficult to identify.
- Some apps may not be selected due to checkbox visibility issues, resulting in missing costs in the Preview Invoice.
- The confirmation email omits app costs and shows an incorrect total.

Title: (SP20) :  Issues in Stock Out Add Screen When First Opening it
Description:
### Description
__Title: Issues in Stock Out Add Screen*
_Project/Module:_ ERP System ? Inventory Management
_Severity:_ High
----
__Issue Description*
The _Stock Out Add Screen_ has multiple issues:
- The _"Source Document"_ label does not display a _star symbol (_)*, indicating it as a required field.
- No _validation message_ is displayed when the _"Source Document"_ field is left empty, and the user clicks the _Save_ button.
- The screen does not include a _default empty item line_, which is expected when opening the screen.
----
__Steps to Reproduce*
- Navigate to the _Inventory >> Transaction_ module.
- Open the _Stock Out Add Screen_.
- Check for the presence of a _default empty item line_ when the screen loads.
- Observe the _"Source Document"_ label for the required star symbol (*).
- Click the _Save_ button without providing any value for the _Source Document_ field.
- Observe the absence of a validation message.
----
__Expected Behavior*
- The _"Source Document"_ label should include a _star symbol (_)*, clearly indicating it as a required field.
- When the user clicks _Save_ without providing a value for the _Source Document_ field, a _descriptive validation message_ should appear (e.g., "_Source Document is required_").
- The screen should display a _default empty item line_ when first opened, allowing users to input item details.
----
__Actual Behavior*
- The _"Source Document"_ label does not include a star symbol (*), making it unclear that it is required.
- Clicking _Save_ without entering a value for _Source Document_ does not trigger any validation message.
- No _default empty item line_ is displayed when opening the screen.

Description:
### Description
_Title: Selected Items Unchecked When Navigating Pages in Item Code Advanced Search Dialog_
_Project/Module:_ ERP System ? Sales (Price Policy)

When using the _Advanced Search Dialog_ to select item codes in the _Price Policy_ screen (Sales app), selected items are _unchecked_ if the user navigates between pages in the dialog. ----
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Navigate to _Sales ? Price Policy ? Add/Edit Price Policy_.
- Click on _Item Code_ to open the _Advanced Search Dialog_.
- Select multiple item codes from the first page.
- Navigate to the next page without clicking "Confirm."
- Return to the previous page.
----
_Expected Behavior:_
_ Selected items should _remain checked and persist* when navigating between pages in the Advanced Search Dialog.
_ Users should be able to _select multiple items across multiple pages* without losing prior selections.
_Actual Behavior:_
_ Selected items from previous pages are _unchecked* when the user navigates to a different page.
_ Users experience _ambiguity and potential errors* as previously selected items do not appear in the final selection after confirming.
----

Title: (SP20) General : Filter Reset in List View When Navigating with Paginator
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Filter Reset in List View When Navigating with Paginator
----
__Description:*
When a user applies a filter in any List view and navigates through different pages using the paginator, the system fails to retain the applied filter. As a result, the filter resets, and the user is presented with unfiltered data upon returning to the List view.
----
__Precondition:*
- The user has access to a List view with a filter and a paginator implemented.
- A filter has been applied to narrow down the displayed data.
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to a List view (Payment In List View).
- Apply a filter (e.g., filtering by "Status: Posted").
- Use the paginator to move to another page (e.g., Page 2).
- Another way change the Maximum Count to be Displayed in the Page.
- Return to the original page or refresh the List view.
----
__Expected Result:*
The applied filter should persist across different pages, and the List view should continue displaying filtered data regardless of navigation or refresh.
----
__Actual Result:*
The filter resets when navigating through the paginator or refreshing the List view, and unfiltered data is displayed instead.

- Review the displayed Debit and Credit sums at the bottom of the statement.

----
_Expected Behavior:_
* The total sum of Debit under the debit column should have the correct value of the total sum of all the Debits in the Debit Column.
*  The total sum of Credit under the Credit column should have the correct value of the total sum of all the Credits in the Credit Column.
_Actual Behavior:_
_ The total sum of Debit under the debit column _does not_ have the correct value of the _total sum* of all the Debits in the Debit Column.
_  The total sum of Credit under the Credit column _does not_ have correct value of the _total sum* of all the Credits in the Credit Column.

### Description
__Title*: Descriptive Columns (e.g., Code, Name) Can Be Unchecked in Show/Hide Column Feature

_Status_: Open

__Description*:

- Uncheck essential descriptive columns like "Code" or "Name."

__Expected Result*:
_ _Critical descriptive columns (e.g., "Code," "Name") should be fixed and unchangeable.*
_ _Users should not be able to uncheck these columns.*
_ _If the user attempts to uncheck them, a validation message should appear:*
_"Essential descriptive columns cannot be hidden to preserve record identification."_
----
__Actual Result*:
* Descriptive columns are unchecked without restriction.
* The grid displays rows with only the "Action" column, making it impossible to distinguish records.

----

* This inconsistency disrupts the user experience and may cause usability issues for Arabic-speaking users.
* It reduces the overall localization quality and professionalism of the system.

Title: (Sp20): UI Issues in Fonts, Spacing, and Language Directionality in Login Screen
Description:
### Description
_ _Title*: Font Size, Vertical Spacing, and Language Directionality Issues
----
_ _Description*:
The current user interface exhibits several design and usability issues:
_- _Font Size*:
_-_ The font size of field hints and button labels is too small, making it difficult for users to read comfortably.
_- _Vertical Spacing*:
_-_ There is insufficient vertical spacing between the header and sub-header, resulting in a crowded appearance.
_- _Language Directionality*:
_-_ When the language is switched to Arabic, the font directionality remains _LTR (left-to-right)_ instead of _RTL (right-to-left)_, which is inconsistent with Arabic text conventions.
----
_ _Preconditions*:
__ The user accesses a screen with fields, buttons, headers, and sub-headers.
__ The user changes the system language to Arabic.
----
_ _Steps to Reproduce*:
*- Open any screen with input fields, buttons, headers, and sub-headers.
*- Observe the font size of field hints and button labels.
*- Observe the spacing between the header and sub-header.
_- Switch the language to _Arabic* in the system settings.
*- Observe the font directionality after the language change.
----
_ _Expected Results*:
_- _Font Size*:
_-_ Field hints and button labels should have a font size that ensures readability and accessibility.
_- _Vertical Spacing*:
_-_ There should be adequate vertical spacing between the header and sub-header to enhance visual clarity and alignment.
_- _Language Directionality*:
_-_ When switching to Arabic, the text directionality should automatically change to _RTL_ to align with Arabic language norms.
----
_ _Actual Results*:
_- _Font Size*:
_-_ Field hints and button labels are rendered with a small font size, making them hard to read.
_- _Vertical Spacing*:
_-_ Insufficient spacing between the header and sub-header creates a visually cramped layout.
_- _Language Directionality*:
_-_ Text remains _LTR_ when the language is switched to Arabic, causing inconsistency and usability issues for Arabic-speaking users.
* 
_ _Severity*: Medium
_ _Priority*: High

Title: (SP20):Design Issues in the New Login Screen of Microtec ERP
Description:
### Description
_ _Title*: Design Faults in the New Login Screen of Microtec ERP
----
_ _Description*:
The newly implemented login screen of the Microtec ERP has several design flaws that impact the professionalism and user perception of the system. The percentage value displayed for "Sales Growth" is unreasonably low at _45%_, which can negatively affect user morale. Additionally, the image depicting an employee using the system features a _young boy in casual attire_, which does not align with the formal and professional tone expected for an ERP system catering to business environments.
----
_ _Issues Identified*:
_- _Percentage Display*:
_-_ The "Sales Growth" percentage is set at _45%_, which gives the impression of poor performance. This value should either reflect realistic, customizable data or be removed if irrelevant.
_- _Image of Employee*:
_-_ The login screen features a _young boy in casual clothing_, which is unprofessional for a corporate ERP system. The image should be replaced with a representation of a professional employee in formal attire to align with the target audience and business context.
----
_ _Preconditions*:
*- The user is presented with the login screen of the Microtec ERP.
*- The design elements (percentage growth, background image) are visible on the screen.
----
_ _Steps to Reproduce*:
_- Navigate to the _Microtec ERP Login Screen*.
*- Observe the "Sales Growth" percentage displayed.
*- Observe the image of the employee featured on the login screen.
----
_ _Expected Result*:
__ The login screen should maintain a _professional and motivating appearance_ with:
__* An appropriate sales growth percentage or no percentage if not required.
__* A formal image of an employee in professional attire.
----
_ _Actual Result*:
__ The "Sales Growth" percentage is set at a low and discouraging value of _45%_.
__ The featured employee image is unprofessional, showing a young boy in casual clothing.

*- Open the exported file.

In the Stock out module's "Add" screen, the _Subtotal_ is successfully calculated the first time. However, if the user changes the cost value, the _Subtotal_ does not update and remains fixed, causing inaccurate calculations.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to the _Inventory App_.
- Go to _Transactions_ > _Stock Out_.
- Click on the _Add_ button to open the "Add Stock out" screen.
- Fill in the required fields, including the _Cost_, and notice the _Subtotal_ is calculated correctly.
- Change the _Cost_ value and observe the _Subtotal_ field.
__Actual Result:*
The _Subtotal_ remains unchanged and does not reflect the updated _Cost_ value.
__Expected Result:*
The _Subtotal_ should recalculate automatically whenever the _Cost_ value is modified.
